intro: Himeranthus runcinatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bittersweet, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Himeranthus runcinatus is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
